description: An ancient Greek breastplate made of bronze.
A solid, single-piece cuirass made from bronze.  It isn't particularly well designed, but it does its job.
A cuirass made of multiple pieces of tough leather, laced together for durable yet flexible protection.

A cuirass made of small strips of sheet metal laced together, something of an intermediary between chain mail and plate armor.  It's less Mad Max and more Garage Mongolian, but the classics are classic for a reason.
A cuirass made of small strips of sheet metal laced together, something of an intermediary between chain mail and plate armor.  The perfect size for an orc or bipedal grizzly bear.
A cuirass made of small strips of sheet metal laced together, something of an intermediary between chain mail and plate armor.  Perfectly sized for a particularly angry rat-person, yes-yes.
A cuirass made of small strips of sheet metal laced together, something of an intermediary between chain mail and plate armor.  This one has been case hardened for extra protection.
A hardened cuirass made of small strips of sheet metal laced together, something of an intermediary between chain mail and plate armor.  Built larger for a minotaur guarding their labyrinth.
A hardened cuirass made of small strips of sheet metal laced together, something of an intermediary between chain mail and plate armor.  Just the right size for a fantasy dwarf.
An ancient Roman laminar armor, made of overlapping metal strips connected to internal leather straps.

This armor, made of interlocking plates of burnished bronze, appears to be either a high-quality recreation or a genuine artifact.  Despite having an ancient design, it is in mint condition aside from some battle damage.  It covers from the shoulders to the hips and is of extremely high quality.
Two sheets of metal hammered to fit your torso and riveted to leather belts to act as straps.  Heavy, uncomfortable, and difficult to move in, but it should help keep your blood inside your body.
//: The weight assumes the sheet metal is 75cm x 50cm x 1.5mm.

name.str: case hardened sheet metal chest guard

description: A chest guard made of hammered sheet metal, case hardened for added protection.  It's not any easier to move in, but it is much sturdier now.

A double-decker chest guard made from two sheets of metal layered over each other and hammered to fit your torso.  Monstrously heavy, but it's quite protective and the thicker material makes it sturdier.
//: The weight assumes the sheet metal is 75cm x 50cm x 1.5mm, doubled.

name.str: case hardened heavy sheet metal chest guard

description: Double-thick, case hardened sheet metal hammered to fit your torso.  Offers the best protection a junkyard knight could ask for.
One sheet of metal, cut in half to only cover your upper torso and back and riveted to leather belts to act as straps.  It's heavy and uncomfortable, but at least you can bend at the waist.
//: The weight assumes the sheets are 35cm x 50cm x 1.5mm.

name.str: case hardened light sheet metal chest guard

description: Sheet metal cut to only cover your upper torso and case hardened for extra protection.  Provides a decent compromise between protection and being able to move.
A crude form of armor made from thickly-stacked paper and rolls of duct tape.
Armor fashioned from from overlapping chunks of tire and rolls of duct tape, covering the shoulders and torso.
A customized chainmail vest.  The metal shows signs of rust and corrosion.  It's a sleeveless piece of chainmail with small straps designed to better distribute the weight.
A customized mild steel chainmail vest.  It's a sleeveless piece of chainmail with small straps designed to better distribute the weight.
A customized medium steel chainmail vest.  It's a sleeveless piece of chainmail with small straps designed to better distribute the weight.
A customized high steel chainmail vest.  It's a sleeveless piece of chainmail with small straps designed to better distribute the weight.
A customized high steel chainmail vest.  It's a sleeveless piece of chainmail with small straps designed to better distribute the weight.
A customized tempered steel chainmail vest.  It's a sleeveless piece of chainmail with small straps designed to better distribute the weight.
A thick cotton sweatshirt that an amateur tailor sewed ever-increasing amounts of cloth onto, providing noticeable, if haphazard padding.

A thick cotton shirt with the sleeves cut off and large amounts of cloth sewn in to make a padded vest.  It would be fashionable, if not for all the disparate colors from the patchwork cotton cannibalized from other random clothes.
A solid vest of plastic padding protecting your torso.
A steel breastplate, and a vital part of plate armor.  Even as full armor went into decline, cuirasses remained in use among cavalry in Europe.
A cuirass made from scraps of metal secured by simple strings.
A cuirass made from thick chunks of tire secured by simple strings; the loose collection of rubber plates provides decent but not the most convenient protection.
A padded jacket with a zipper on the back, used by fencers to prevent accidents.
An armored jacket made from thick leather and metal plates.

A black jacket made from thick leather and covered with intricately carved bones.  You've never seen patterns like those before, each time you look at them you spot a new one as if they were changing on their own.
A jacket reinforced with chunks of thick rubber tire.  Bulky and heavy, but thick and immune to electricity.
A thin, lightweight conductive vest with the zipper on the back used by fencers for electronic scoring.  Its outer layer is a woven mix of sturdy cotton and stainless steel strands.
A thin, lightweight conductive jacket used by fencers for electronic scoring.  Its outer layer is a woven mix of sturdy cotton and stainless steel strands.
Heavy polycarbonate armor for your upper torso.  Normally worn by football players.
A lightweight level II ballistic vest, suitable for wearing under a coat or other outer wear.

A light jacket made of a stretch mesh covered in plastic pads meant for motorcyclists.  Made to be much more comfortable to wear than leather alternatives, but the underlying lycra isn't protective at all.
A sturdy cotton plastron that protects much of the torso, the dominant shoulder, and underarm while fencing.
A rigid plastic plastron with molded cups to be worn by female fencers for protection while fencing.
An armored vest made from thick leather and metal plates.
A thick armored jacket constructed from Kevlar and Nomex for use by explosive ordnance disposal technicians.

An armored jacket constructed from Kevlar and Nomex for use by explosive ordnance disposal technicians.  It is lighter than normal EOD armor to provide more maneuverability and can be worn over ballistic armor.
A light chestplate, 2mm thick.  This one has been made with mild steel.
A light chestplate, 2mm thick.  Made with tougher medium steel, offering solid protection.
A light chestplate, 2mm thick.  Made with high carbon steel, offering excellent protection.
A light chestplate, 2mm thick.  The mild steel has been case hardened, offering superior protection.
A light chestplate, 2mm thick.  The medium steel has been quenched and tempered, offering top-of-the-line protection.
A chestplate, 4mm thick.  This one has been made with mild steel.
A chestplate, 4mm thick.  Made with tougher medium steel, offering solid protection.
A chestplate, 4mm thick.  Made with high carbon steel, offering excellent protection.
A chestplate, 4mm thick.  The mild steel has been case hardened, offering superior protection.
A chestplate, 4mm thick.  The medium steel has been quenched and tempered, offering top-of-the-line protection.
A heavy chestplate, 6mm thick.  This one has been made with mild steel.
A heavy chestplate, 6mm thick.  Made with tougher medium steel, offering solid protection.
A heavy chestplate, 6mm thick.  Made with high carbon steel, offering excellent protection.
A heavy chestplate, 6mm thick.  The mild steel has been case hardened, offering superior protection.
A heavy chestplate, 6mm thick.  The medium steel has been quenched and tempered, offering top-of-the-line protection.
Armor made of combined pre-Cataclysm clothing.  Sections from leather clothing are tightened and affixed to a thick cotton shirt, excluding the joints.
Armor made of combined pre-Cataclysm clothing.  Sections from leather clothing are tightened and affixed to a thick cotton shirt.  The sleeves have been cut off.
A hard chest protector, attached to thigh and upper arm guards.  Used by riot police officers.  Molle webbing is attached to the thighs.  The word POLICE is emblazoned across the front.
A leather chest plate with attached shoulder guards.
